pros: Runs off of a 9 volt battery
Convenient in a lot of applications
cons: Gunsafe can run through the batteries
When the battery dies it cannot be opened without the key

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: I don't hate the vault, the vault is handy for jewelry and important documents... but I wouldn’t say it’s good for a firearm at all. The time it takes to read your fingerprint and open is about 5 - 10 SECONDS, and it doesn't even pop open with spring assisted. And say it can't read your finger prints for whatever reason. The "code" buttons don't even WORK!! Except for the first one which you have to press in order to read your fingerprint. If I knew about this I would have not wasted my money on it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent finger print scanner
customer_reviews.text: The size of great for a 9mm and an extra clip. However, the finger print recognition doesn't seem to work well. Out of 20 swipes it will work roughly 15 times. I'll reset it, reprogram, and get similar results. If ever needed in an emergency it needs to work the first time! Also, I thought you could also program a pattern with the buttons just as with the non-finger printer model, but that doesn't seem to be the case. The other buttons don't seem to serve a purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable and overpriced
customer_reviews.text: Garbage!! I've purchased three of these. The bio finger reader performs very badly. Any laptop that has a built in reader works far better. In addition, if the battery runs low, it seems not to have enough power to open the safe. They come with a key, but I don't want to keep the key any place that isn't secure! I think that both safes ran low on battery, so I had to destroy them in order to get them open. Through the last one in the trash. Don't waste your money. There are much better options available.
customer_reviews.author: dpm

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Work, Waste of Money!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have used multiple types of biometric access finger print scanners to set up security systems, computer password authentication, etc. This is the poorest fingerprint scanner/reader that I have ever seen. After setting up the fingerprint reader, it sometimes takes 15-20 finger swipes before the reader will open the box. I would have just used the manual finger key pad, but when they added the finger print reader to the design, they disabled the keypad so you can only use the fingerprint reader or key to open, so it truly is worthless. Terrible design!! The only good news is that once locked up, your kids can't get into it. Unfortunately, you can't either when you really need it!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Clipper2

customer_reviews.title: Almost good
customer_reviews.text: If this had a keypad PIN# entry option I may have replaced it. Maybe mine was the 1 out of a 1000 that just came together wrong, regardless, I was under the impression that your options to open were the key, fingerprint, and PIN, there is not an option to open with the key pad. I don;t trust the biometric element that much, so even if mine did work properly I would not have used it as my primary pistol storage. The return process was pretty simple ass most Amazon Prime stuff is, maybe I should have read the description even closer somehow, but why is there four buttons on the top if only one has a purpose?
customer_reviews.author: Section

customer_reviews.title: Lower Your Expectations
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed with the bio-metrics on the Mirco-Vault. Maybe I set my expectations to high being an iPhone user who uses the fingerprint method for unlocking my phone. The Micro-Vault took me way too long to set up (bio-metrics). I was able to get one finger to work but I can say opening the vault is unreliable. If there's an urgent need to access my gun I need the key, the bio-metrics is simply unpredictable. When I have an hour or so I'm going to sit down again with the unit again and try to reprogram the the vault. The Vault is well built and looks good just keep the key accessible!
customer_reviews.author: J. Hewitt

customer_reviews.title: Good Safe, But BURNS Through Batteries
customer_reviews.text: It's generally a nice safe- i.e.- durable, etc. The combo keys are user-friendly and the biometric feature works on the first try 80-90% of the time. Downside is the frequency at which I have to change the battery. It really burns through them. I don't carry every day and probably only need to open the safe 6-8 times per week (3-4 uses, in-and-out). Even at this low usage, the batteries dies every few weeks. If used for the purposes of home protection, I would suggest either changing the batteries quite often or having the keys handy. I read the reviews beforehand, so I had some idea that this would be the case, so I gave it four stars.
customer_reviews.author: Drew B.

customer_reviews.title: Biometrics not reliable enough
customer_reviews.text: After many months of trying different fingers and speeds, the biometrics simply don't work. I was going to return it but have exceeded the time limit. Overall, it's the right size for one pistol and a clip but if you can't get insid quickly its of little use. Buy the push button one not the biometrics.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding product
customer_reviews.text: First off, what an outstanding safe and will competely serve our purpose. The biometrics work wonderfully. Now for the bad part.....not sure someone could have written/produced worse paper instructions. The pictures don't match the explanation, the instructions are not complete, and important information (like the type and potency of the battery) are not mentioned. BUT, the customer support when you call OUTSTANDING. I will recommend this product to other LEO'S.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy L Barnett

customer_reviews.title: This was the best price. You can scan tons of finger prints ...
customer_reviews.text: These are very expensive in the stores and any where else on line. This was the best price. You can scan tons of finger prints and it is the perfect size for under the bed security no need to worry about little tots getting in there or snoopy teenagers over seeing your code. Very secure and I feel very safe knowing I can get in quickly while it keeps unwanted users out. Scan your own finger as many times as you can it will help it recognize your print the first time my husband and I both scanned about 50 times annoying at first but ensures it works every time.
customer_reviews.author: kristin green

customer_reviews.title: Terribly Unreliable Technology
customer_reviews.text: If you want your family safe, do NOT buy this product. The biometrics works ok when you first program it but if you need to open it in a hurry, you have to swipe your fingers over and over and MAYBE it will work. 4 out of 5 times I have to get into it I have to reach for the key because it seems to forget the fingerprints. I gave it a 1-Star because there is no ZERO star rating, This is a complete piece of crap that will get you killed if you ever do have an intruder and need quick access to your weapon.
customer_reviews.author: Ray V

customer_reviews.title: A little slow to open but overall pretty good. STUPID THAT THE BUTTONS DON'T DO ANYTHING
customer_reviews.text: A little slow to open but overall pretty good. STUPID THAT THE BUTTONS DON'T DO ANYTHING. Only the biometric feature works, you can't also make a combination. key. It's worth it if you find a great price. Be safe and do what you can to keep your stuff locked away from children. If survivability and protecting your loved ones is your goal then remember this. Your family is more likely to be harmed by your weapons than by an intruder.
customer_reviews.author: Salchicha Stallion

customer_reviews.title: Good... not great
customer_reviews.text: As other reviews note this is a nice, well made, product that could use some refinements. The size is perfect and easily fits a full-size auto. I also love the fact that the sounds from the button and fingerprint scanner can be turned off. However, the fingerprint scanner is too finicky. It works but you must swipe your finger the exact same way each time. It can sometimes take several passes before opening. I have tried reprogramming it several times to no avail.. I find this strange since it is not new technology. The bio-metric scanner on my laptop is much more accurate and it is a few years old. I'm sure Gunvault can do better.
customer_reviews.author: orion

customer_reviews.title: How did I live without it!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a single male and I didn't think I really need gun vaults, boy was I wrong! In no way did anything happen, but once I bought the Gunvault I thought, why haven't I had this? I keep this in my car, under the passenger seat, and I feel I am being a better gun owner! The security cable that is included, just gives me a great sense of security. I spent the extra money for the biometric model and was disappointed after calling the company and finding out that the finger combination is only a deterrent. I love full disclosure and then found out only the finger print scanner is the way to open the safe, besides the key.
customer_reviews.author: wilsonian

customer_reviews.title: Stay Away from this one!
customer_reviews.text: Was unable to get this to recognize my fingerprint swipe. NOT reliable for emergency access to self defense weapon!! Have 2-GunVault MV500 manual combination safes, same size, which I love. Strong, securable in car trunk w/included cable, for one, or bedside storage for the other one.
customer_reviews.author: Howard Van Dine

customer_reviews.title: Best ever
customer_reviews.text: I could not get it in my husbands head to keep the gun up safely. Finally after almost resorting to pull a Kardashian and burry it in cement, I came across this bad boy. I ordered it and it is an instant fix. He can now carry his gun (albeit in a safe) and we don't have to worry about curious kids messing with it. I have tried numerous techniques to try and break into the safe and have had no luck. The keys are safely hidden but I am happy knowing that the kids cannot get into the safe!
customer_reviews.author: Heidi Berard

customer_reviews.title: Cool but doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: Tried this product. Looked great on paper. But I couldn't get the biometric device to take my fingerprint, and after a while I felt like a dog scratching at the door to get in. I was also surprised and disappointed to learn that there are two options for opening this little safe, the keys or the biometric pad. I bought it thinking that it retained the keys of other Gunvault products, which would be useful if your batteries died, as they sometimes do. I'm going to try a non-biometric model. Will take a full-size 1911, 4 inch L-frame Smith with grips beyond the grip frame, as well as 4 and 5 inch N frame smiths, again with extended grips.
customer_reviews.author: Immortalgummy

customer_reviews.title: I did it and it work fine now. The batteries I removed still had plenty ...
customer_reviews.text: Had some issues after a while. It would not open with my code. I had to call the support desk and I was told to replace the batteries with "Fresh" ones that had at least 10 years expiration date. I did it and it work fine now. The batteries I removed still had plenty of life and voltage left in them. Seems like the electronics should not be that sensitive, and the manual as well as the online help should reflect this battery requirement.
customer_reviews.author: Phil D.

customer_reviews.title: Frustrating to Program
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic once you get it programmed. The programming instructions in the manual are incomplete. Took 45 minutes (!) on hold waiting for customer service to find out the missing info. I love the size, and it seems very substantial and well constructed. But why can't the company supply a clearly written, complete owners manual? The necessary ink for two more sentences won't cost much.
customer_reviews.author: A. Dalton

customer_reviews.title: Gun Safe
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to put a hang gun in my car under the seat with some security. It does do its job as to keep everything sucure in the car. The issue I am having with it is the Biometric part. I use my hands for many tasks, and my fingers get a little rough at times. This safe does not like cuts in the fingers at all. Grease, dirty, not so good either. So if you keep your fingers all nice and pretty, this would be a great safe for you, otherwise not so good. Also the battery has a tough time in the winter months with the cold.
customer_reviews.author: FIRE 20

customer_reviews.title: Good, solid product
customer_reviews.text: This item is exactly as it was described and works very well. It is small and will hold two or more hand guns easily and safely, preventing children in the home from accessing them. It is easy to use and small enough to store in a drawer or closet with no problem. In the even that the electronics should fail there is a key that will allow entry, but the electronics work well and quickly. I would recommend this to anyone who has handguns and children!
customer_reviews.author: Mary Ann

customer_reviews.title: Perfect piece of mind.
customer_reviews.text: Great vault to keep curious hands off of your defense piece. Works flawlessly with every attempt. Opens quickly, fits in night stand drawer. I want 4 more to place in my vehicles and other rooms in the house. Worth every penny just for the piece of mind it provides. Highly recommend this vault, have had in-laws purchase 1 and they love it. A must have if there are children in the home or car. My kids are well trained on handling firearms but some of their friends may not be, don't take a chance that may devastate a family, Buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Jason Honse

customer_reviews.title: Could Not Set It Up
customer_reviews.text: My wife was able to program most of her fingers, with several attempts. My fingers however were impossible. If you have any scratches, cuts or just dry skin ...good luck. I stood there frustrated for about an hour until we both decided to pack it back up. We figured if we could not even get it to recognize me now, what good will it be in an emergency. Regarding the security of the unit and construction...they are great, but be patient and make sure your fingers are always nice and clear if you buy this product.
customer_reviews.author: steelebear

customer_reviews.title: sensitivity
customer_reviews.text: Even with vague instructions, I was able to setup the administrator prints. However, my wife's fingers would not register after many, many attempts. We tried both of her hands and my other fingers without success. I could get it to open about 1/4 of the time with my prints. I just don't feel confident enough to count on this product if there was an emergency. I'm returning this one and ordering the same brand without the biometrics.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Powell

customer_reviews.title: A great idea with horrible execution
customer_reviews.text: This safe is based on a great idea but it's executed poorly on its most critical feature. The fingerprint reader is completely unreliable. Sometimes it reads my finger and sometimes it does not. The whole thought behind this safe is when you need fast access to your weapon and can't rely on remembering and hitting a correct code under stress that your simple finger swipe will give you access to your gun. You simply can not trust the technology on the biometric reader. It's completely unreliable. This product is a huge disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: joe

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Received new and as expected. Did some research on a dresser-top easy access vault to keep my .40 away from my daughter and other curious kids, but quickly accessable at home when it's not holstered on me. Simple, effective, high quality. I would recommend any GunVault product to anyone. It could hold 2 pistols depending on size w/ an extra mag or 2. No fumbling in the middle of the night. Push the button & swipe any finger on the biometric pad and it pops open ready to eliminate the threat. Will buy another for my wifes pistol.
customer_reviews.author: vikingpiper

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy if you work with your hands.
customer_reviews.text: This is not for the do it yourselfer or anyone who works with their hands. I spent 20 min. trying to get into this box after a day of sanding cabinetry. I finally figured out that the sandpaper I was working with altered my fingerprint enough that the biometric reader wouldn't recognize it. I returned it and got the manual version which I would easily give 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: Batteries last less than 2 months. I replaced batteries at the end of December using high quality Duracell batteries and now at the end of February this thing is dead again. Poor battery life and you cant trust it unless you keep replacing batteries every month. You have to be very delicate and carefull with how you put you finger on the scanner and even though you might have to slide your finger multiple times to open. I am disappointed with this product. Biometrick feature is a joke. I have lenovo laptop with fingerprint scanner that is twice as reliable as this safe.
customer_reviews.author: Julita

customer_reviews.title: Neat
customer_reviews.text: The safe itself seems very sturdy. The bio-metric reading aspect is very cool. The one concern I have about the bio-metric feature is if I need the gun in an emergency situation, it could potentially be hard to get to because you have to run your finger over the reader at a specific rate. Too fast and it fails. Start your finger at the wrong position and it fails. Other than that, I like it a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Scott A. Enders

customer_reviews.title: Gunvault
customer_reviews.text: The product arrived new and in original manufacturer packaging. The only issue that I have is it fails to recognize my finger eight times out of ten. The same goes for my other family members who read the directions and used their prints without any help from me. I don't know if the finger scanner is defective, but I can't rely on this to house anything I will need quick access to in an emergency. Kinda defeats the purpose!
customer_reviews.author: John C Clark

customer_reviews.title: A little disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Good product but lid does not spring up at all when you unlock it. Have to use my fingernail while opening to lift the lid.
customer_reviews.author: Harrison S Reed III

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I really needed a way to keep my weapon close, but out of the hands of the grand kids. After reading a ton of reviews for this item, I decided to give it a shot. I am completely satisfied with this product. Ive had it about a month, and have had only one negative read. It was very quick to read my fingerprint, and I have gone a few days between scans, with no issues. Would recommend to anyone looking for a product of this nature.
customer_reviews.author: andrew workman

customer_reviews.title: Gunvault makes great small safes
customer_reviews.text: Gunvault makes great small safes. I have a finger pad type (minivault and microvault) which work every time; however, the biometric function on the MVB500 works when it wants to and I would not be willing to bet my health and safety that it will work when I need it
customer_reviews.author: eye dr

customer_reviews.title: Gunvault Biometric
customer_reviews.text: I just bought this biometric box as a gift for my husband. He likes it very much. Though we've only used it for a couple of weeks now, it has opened with no problems for us. It takes a couple of seconds to get the box to open, but I am sure that we will get better with it in time. Besides, this box beats having to unlock my gun box during emergency situations. I highly recommend giving this box a try.
customer_reviews.author: D. Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Poor fingerprint recognition quality
customer_reviews.text: purchases products for rapid access to handgun in case of emergency and to provide security, prevention of children in the home accessing firearm. Works very well for the latter aspect but unfortunately I have had to swipe the finger print recognition apparatus multiple times to access the safe. Would not recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: Mick

customer_reviews.title: Safe Works as Stated
customer_reviews.text: It took a few minutes to figure out how to program my finger print, but once I did it worked great. I have had not issues with this unit and at the most it takes 2 swipes of my finger to get the reader to recognize my print which is no different then my computer. I use this safe under my bed and have the cable wrapped around my bed frame. It holds my 1911 with the extra clip easily with room to spare. I highly recommend this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Deemack68

customer_reviews.title: Very nice Gun Vault, Fingerprint reader is only a novelty though.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice gun vault, seems pretty secure and is CA approved. Fingerprint scanning on it seems to be worth the extra price to me, but its pretty unreliable so make sure you have the key with you. Case would of got 5 stars but took one away for the fingerprint reader.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Maus

customer_reviews.title: Infernal beep
customer_reviews.text: Finally figured out how to swipe the finger to get it to open, however, cannot turn off the beep it makes upon opening. Kind of counter productive if trying to get the gun out in the dark when an intruder is in your house and you don't want to expose your location!!!
customer_reviews.author: Cat Lover 6

customer_reviews.title: a little finicky
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to purchase this, as i read other reviews about the scanner being finicky. I set it up in about 10 minutes, and test it every other day. While it sometimes takes 2 or 3 swipes of the finger, it does work. I do not have the problem that other people mentioned about the battery dying quickly. I havent had to replace it yet, and its been 4 months..
customer_reviews.author: scott prasek

customer_reviews.title: Great little safe
customer_reviews.text: This item worked exactly as described, right out of the box. I had no issues entering new fingerprints, and it recognizes my print on the first try, every time. I've put off getting one of these for a while based on negative reviews, but finally decided to give it a try. I'm glad I did. 12 June 2012 Update: So far I have added both my wife's and my own fingerprints to the memory, and it works every time. I do a periodic/random function check to verify that it's still working, and it has always worked on the first try. Absolutely reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Red Lace

customer_reviews.title: Don't Beleive the Nay Sayers
customer_reviews.text: I did alot of reading reviews about the product before buying it. I have had it over a month before I wrote this. For the most part, the reviews were very positive. But there were the occasional negative reviews did have me wondering. The product is great. It works everytime and is easily programed. I am very happy with the product. For me out of the box after 10 minutes of reading and I have never looked back. If you are even thinking about this product, get it!
customer_reviews.author: R

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and reliable
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Easy to open. I have had no issue opening it from virtually any position, seems to be good at recognizing my fingerprints. Cons: No "code" opening option - just in case the hand is dirty and fingerprint does not get detected properly. Overall: I'm happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: DJC

customer_reviews.title: Great safe !!
customer_reviews.text: Great safe and I love the finger print lock.... Programmed it with my wife and mine fingerprint and it works perfectly.... Did take the advice of some of the others reviewers and programmed each of our fingers multiple times because you must run your finger over the scanner EXACTLY the way you did when you program it if not...Just spend a couple of extra minutes and It works like a charm!!!! Fits is a small drawer too!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kratano

customer_reviews.title: Love this little gun safe.
customer_reviews.text: Got this safe for my carry piece. Love the heck out of it. Only one thing I would change about it is to get rid of the little audible beep when you are opening it. Kind of a dead giveaway if you are trying to open it in the dead of night because you heard a noise in the house. Guess I am going to have to open the top and try and cut the speaker wire if I can find it. Other than that I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Dale S. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this gun safe in October 2014. It took a while to figure out how to input the fingerprints. I was just about to give up and call the manufacturer. But then it all came together and began to work well. If you get frustrated, just keep working at it. I am very pleased with this safe. In fact, I am getting ready to order another one for a gift. The amazon price (bought through the manufacturer) is significantly lower than ordering directly through the manufacturer's website. Even though it is coming from the manufacturer through Amazon. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jill Etter

customer_reviews.title: Good for criminals because you'll never get your pistol out to use it.
customer_reviews.text: Bad device. Tried multiple times to get it opened. I read the online reviews after I purchased this item. Not a good idea. I found the unit had all the problems that others have experienced. I will return this and not buy another.
customer_reviews.author: General goods

customer_reviews.title: Works Amazingly Well
customer_reviews.text: If you swipe your finger totally horizontally, it opens every time. Plenty well made. Much better than pushing buttons I think. Can't comment on battery life after only 6 weeks or so. Edit: After 2+ yrs with original battery and infrequent use, everything is still like new.
customer_reviews.author: Cyclist

customer_reviews.title: Problems with biometric scanner on fingerprints of older users
customer_reviews.text: The biometric scan window was too small to perform accurate fingerprint recognition for older people, whose fingerprints are not easily read. It worked ok for younger users, who had more prominent fingerprints. Older people have thinner skin and more age wrinkles on their hands, including the fingerprints. Tried to set up several times, but could not consistently read our fingerprints, so it would lock up....had to use a key to open. I have returned the Gun Safe to Amazon for a credit.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Windsor

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: If security and safety are important, this should be your first stop. I got this on the advice of a friend. We both have young children so securing firearms is imperative, while this box still allows quick access whenever needed. It is also portable with a cable, and can be used to secure items in a vehicle when traveling.
customer_reviews.author: MD

customer_reviews.title: It actually works
customer_reviews.text: I bought this safe a month ago for my Glock 21(.45), whats great is it has enough room for an extra mag and its a very inconspicuous looking safe. The only time I have had problems getting it to read my finger is when they crack and peel but I programed all my fingers so usually a different finger does the trick. My only complaint is that it beeps loudly when it opens. 5 year update: Have replaced the batteries once, still reads my fingers perfectly. Still glad i bought it
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable and unusable
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. Good looking and well built box, but despite numerous cycles of patiently programming and reprogramming the biometric recognition the best success rate I could get was about 1 in 5 attempts. Obviously this is unsatisfactory if trying to get access to what's inside in a hurry! Returned for credit and got the standard cypher code one. Too bad.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon User

customer_reviews.title: Great for security, just slow to open
customer_reviews.text: Great idea but there is one reader on the index finger spot that is very finicky. I thought it would read my print faster.
customer_reviews.author: S. B. Littleton

customer_reviews.title: Terrible.  Pure junk.
customer_reviews.text: Anyone considering this item should pass. This is my second purchase of a Gunvault product and just as the first pistol safe this one also never fails to disappoint. The biometric reader failed time after time again. Calls to Gunvault were less than helpful. God bless Amazon and its return policy. Do yourself a favor and purchase a real gun safe such as Fort Knox Pistol safe, Fas1 or Titan. At least you will be getting an American made quality product. It may not be biometric, but it will be reliable and safe.
customer_reviews.author: WEG

customer_reviews.title: Works Perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I was a little skeptical at first, reading some of the reviews on here, but this thing works exactly as promised. Maybe they improved the scanning tech or something. In any case, I easily set it up with my right-hand index-finger print and it opens every time. I was however not able to make it store and recognize my left-hand index finger. Note that rough skin on finger tips ("man hands") might reduce scanning accuracy. It comes with a small cable strap, so you can attach it to something to prevent people from taking it out of the house, or you can attach something else to the safe (the cable cannot be removed without first opening the safe).
customer_reviews.author: agjerde

customer_reviews.title: Nice vault - great idea but burns through batteries
customer_reviews.text: We love the concept of this gun vault, but the bio version burns through batteries like crazy compared to the non-bio version (which we also have). These are very well made vaults, just be prepared to change batteries frequently.
customer_reviews.author: Rebekah Hills

customer_reviews.title: NEVER AGAIN
customer_reviews.text: It does not work and if I had read a little more about it from other sourcesl I would never have purchased it. I have lost many dollars and at least a hundred man hours trying to make it work. I finally dropped the claim and will use it with the key. I will not put any more money in shipping and handling an other expenses. on it Especially no more time. I do not have that much hair left.
customer_reviews.author: Cleft in the Rocks Ministry

customer_reviews.title: This works very well for my needs. However, ...
customer_reviews.text: This works very well for my needs. However, the item arrived in its original box with no packaging to protect it and it was open but did not appear to have anything missing. That concerns me for future purchases of this value.
customer_reviews.author: Kent Ogaard

customer_reviews.title: The finger scanner on this product is difficult. I ...
customer_reviews.text: The finger scanner on this product is difficult. I would actually prefer the MV5000 where you have the button code. I feel that in a pressure situation, this safe would not open even 50% of the time which is not ideal.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's good
customer_reviews.text: It does what it needs. Unfortunately I have yet to figure out how to use the numeric unlock feature. So currently I can unlock it with fingerprint and key - but instructions as to how to use the keypad is not included. Also, this DOES come with a securing cable, so no need to buy one separately
customer_reviews.author: Avi

customer_reviews.title: Finger reader is very particular.
customer_reviews.text: When I chose the MVB500 I thought a biometric gun safe would be the best for a home defense nigh stand safe. No codes to punch in, just swipe your finger. However, I found the finger reader is very particular. You have to have your finger completely flat and not slide too fast. In a home defense situation, this could be a problem. If I were buying a gun safe for my night stand again I would buy one with a numeric code.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Schultz

customer_reviews.title: Isn't reliable for print recognition
customer_reviews.text: Great idea BUT I bought two of these gunvaults being sold on the print recogintion feature preventing unwanted users from opening safe, which they do. However, the print recognition does not consistantly work for approved users, requiring several finger swipes, which could result in a tradgedy itself if the situation ever required quick access.
customer_reviews.author: Brain P

customer_reviews.title: Great secure safe
customer_reviews.text: Excellent safe. Had to return it but with absolutely no problems as it had a manufacturing defect that they replaced with a brand new one. I just packed the old one in the box the new came in and sent it back. Talk about customer service!
customer_reviews.author: loubeau

customer_reviews.title: NOT VERY GOOD
customer_reviews.text: SAFE WAS HARD TO PUT IN FINGERPRINT. IT WORKED FOR A WHILE THEN STARTED TO GIVE TROUBLE. WOULDN'T UNLOCK. CALLED GUNVAULT. WAS TOLD BATTERY MIGHT BE TO OLD. PUT IN NEW BATTERY. STILL WON'T WORK. WILL CALL GUNVAULT FOR THE THIRD TIME TO SEE WHAT TO DO NEXT. WILL RATE THE PRODUCT AGAIN AFTEWR NEXT CALL.
customer_reviews.author: Jimbo

customer_reviews.title: I’m glad I purchased it
customer_reviews.text: Fits both my Bodyguard in a pocket holster and my 9mm Shield. Works everytime, I’m glad I purchased it!
customer_reviews.author: Scott B

customer_reviews.title: Biometric scanning is not reliable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thinking it would be easier to swipe a finger than punch a code. WRONG. The biometric scanner almost never works on the first try. Yes, I've read the instructions several times hoping I missed something but I'm following them exactly. Maybe I have a defective item but I'm not impressed. My next move is to see if I can exchange this one with the MV500.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Reads my prints flawlessly
customer_reviews.text: Reads my print very well and works quick. I have had no misreads or issues. I had my entire family try and no one is getting in but me.
customer_reviews.author: Stann

customer_reviews.title: The gunvault is perfect for the night stand
customer_reviews.text: The gunvault is perfect for the night stand, but you have to scan your fingerprint over the biometric scanner a few times before it opens (10 second delay).
customer_reviews.author: Batman177

customer_reviews.title: almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: I like this gun safe. It is perfect to transporting my handgun. I only gave it 4 stars, because it has a couple of shortcomings. It has no handle to carry the vault, and the biometric feature does not work well in the dark or cold.
customer_reviews.author: Harley7734

customer_reviews.title: Set it up already disappointed. it opens maybe 10 percent of the time
customer_reviews.text: i just got in the mail today. Set it up already disappointed. it opens maybe 10 percent of the time. and why on earth is the finger key feature disabled thats just stupid design
customer_reviews.author: christine

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Great vault and not too expensive. I have kids so this is a must-have for me. I've had this for about 16 months and it's worked fine. Only downside is it beeps fairly loudly when opened so it's not super tactical.
customer_reviews.author: John Biddison

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed so far may return
customer_reviews.text: Does not set up easlily nor is the support for micfovault very friendly and you wait on hold forever. After set up[ unit fails to identify fingerprints in a quick manner. Takes many swipes. Disappointed so far may return.
customer_reviews.author: lakescountry

customer_reviews.title: Works exactly as advertised. Remember to check the batteries ...
customer_reviews.text: Works exactly as advertised. Remember to check the batteries so it will open when you need it to!!!
customer_reviews.author: P. Russo

customer_reviews.title: Gunvault
customer_reviews.text: I was misinformed on this Gun Vault. Thought it was Fire rated but got it and found out it wasn't! would have never bought it had the information been more clear, or correct. I saw that it was fire proof before I ordered, but it was not
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Could not make it work
customer_reviews.text: It would not set up to operate with finger draw activation following the poor instructions that came with it. Give its security value I think they could have done a better job by far.
customer_reviews.author: fiddler

customer_reviews.title: Biometric Gun Vault
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Works perfectly. I mounted it on the back side of my truck console. All that I need do is reach back, swipe my finger, and it is in my hand. Includes a security cable that you can secure around a seat post in the car. I will be buying additional ones for my house.
customer_reviews.author: Scott E. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: easy to order arrived in a very short time. The owners manual was hard to understand but one call number listed and in two minutes it was working fine. It is a must have if you have handguns and young children.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This product works exactly as I expect. Opens on first finger swipe every time. It is easy to setup additional users. Has enough space for 2 handguns, or 1 with lots of spare ammo. Did not give 5 stars because there is a audible beep when activating biometric scan and after validation, although this is a good notification, I wish it could be turned of if the user wishes. I recommend this product to any one with a gun to keep it secure from any unauthorized user messing with gun, especially kids. I like the compact size of size which allows one to travel with safe if needed. Great job Gunvault.
customer_reviews.author: Me Be

customer_reviews.title: Peace of mind!
customer_reviews.text: I appreciate this product. I can keep my pistol handy, but not worry about grand children finding and trying to use it, when they come to visit.
customer_reviews.author: Ginny

customer_reviews.title: Gun Vault
customer_reviews.text: I think it works great. Occasionally it takes two maybe three swipes to open. But I can do it in the dark! Mr. Glock is locked and loaded next to my bed now and I'm not worried about stray hands touching it. I will order another one soon for my wife's side of the bed.
customer_reviews.author: Slotown

customer_reviews.title: not ready for prime time
customer_reviews.text: i took a while to write a review. safe has significant drawbacks, the biometric reader is not reliable enough, in my opinion. often takes multiple swipes to get the vault open....makes me very nervous in a sticky situation.
customer_reviews.author: NYC

customer_reviews.title: GUNVAULT
customer_reviews.text: HAD TROUBLE CODING MY FINGERPRINTS INTO THE SAFE. DOESN'T READ MY PRINTS AT ALL. I JUST USE THE SAFE LOCKED WHEN WE ARE OUT OF THE HOUSE AND LEAVE IT UNLOCKED WITH THE COVER DOWN WHEN WE'RE HOME. VERY DISAPPOINTED. :(
customer_reviews.author: NANA B

customer_reviews.title: This would be awesome if it didn't fault so often - hope there's ...
customer_reviews.text: This would be awesome if it didn't fault so often - hope there's never a real emergency since it only wants to open when it 'feels like it'
customer_reviews.author: Lee-Anne & Jillian

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy
customer_reviews.text: The finger print scanner is slow and works 50% of the time. The other day the vault would not even open, I tried it 20+ times before it finally worked. I would return it but did not realize you only have 30 days to do so. I would not recommend this Amazon vendor.
customer_reviews.author: Palmer Kraeger

customer_reviews.title: safety and Security
customer_reviews.text: We have children but also protect ourselves in an emergency. This Biometric vault allows us to keep a loaded firearm available to my wife and I without worrying about children getting to it.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald O. Dangler Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Nice...easy to use...low profile
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to store new PX4 Storm and keep it from the kids. Great little gun vault to hold the weapon and 2 full magazines. Would recommend to anyone with children...one of the best deals out there.
customer_reviews.author: Earl J. Hebert

customer_reviews.title: BUY THE OTHER MODEL ... NOT THIS ONE!
customer_reviews.text: GunVault makes two (2) versions of this Handgun Safe. This one (MV500B) is biometric, that is it opens with a "finger print"! The other model (MV500) is the same Handgun safe with "manual combination buttons"! The "finger print" (MV500B) version is COMPLETELY UNRELIABLE! Don't buy it! The "manual" (MV500) version is GREAT and actually OPENS FASTER! Buy it at half the price.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: not successful in using fingerprint
customer_reviews.text: It's well constructed, and seems to be a secure holding place, but I am only rarely able to open it without the key. I have tried various speeds, angles, and fingers, but it only recognizes me about once in 12 tries. Not something I want to face in a time of stress! I have not yet tried their tech support, but will re-post after I contact them.
customer_reviews.author: sagebrushbob

customer_reviews.title: Worst Company Ever
customer_reviews.text: Bought this safe, used it for 1 month and the latch stopped working. Tried to contact gunvault to remedy the problem, but after leaving voicemails and emails for a week, finally gave up and returned product to Amazon. You can't get any customer service from gunvault or their sister company Cannon Safes....you always get patched to voicemail. Lots of blogs out there on the internet warn of this already, unfortunately I didn't shop around enough before purchase. Also, the biotmetric reader on the safe is a joke. Don't make the same mistake. Buyer Beware!!!
customer_reviews.author: NaterGator

customer_reviews.title: Good small Safe.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted something that my wife or myself could open in the dark in a hurry. This safe does exactly that. Perfect to keep the kids out and easy enough for the two of us to open. I was concerned that the biometric lock would be unreliable, but it's worked very well. I did register our index fingers multiple times at different speeds and it opens without fail. I also like the fact that it can be used at home or on the road since it's relatively small.
customer_reviews.author: D. Larson

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable opening
customer_reviews.text: When I first purchased the product, it failed to work. The phone help line suggested a fresh battery and that solved the problem. However, the optical scanning of your finger may not always work, requiring numerous tries to open the vault...if you're lucky. If you have hand cream or paint or some substance on your finger, you'll need the key. For rapid access to a pistol, I would suggest getting a punch-in code that you can count on in an emergency.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: The coolest gun vault I've seen. Love the fingerprint technology. Sleep well knowing we're safe.
customer_reviews.author: Dave F

customer_reviews.title: it's nice..
customer_reviews.text: When the sensor works, it's nice... but it only works about 60-70% of the time. Meaning, reswipes are common.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan W.

customer_reviews.title: Picky sensor
customer_reviews.text: I love the idea of not having to have a key and that you select who can open the safe. We keep a gun in there and it is perfect for peace of mind. However, the sensor is very picky when it comes to my prints. My husbands prints work every time. Mine takes several tries which is concerning and it will not register my daughters prints.
customer_reviews.author: Andre

customer_reviews.title: Safety First
customer_reviews.text: Extremely difficult to operate in the biometric mode. It's mounted in a drawer and locked and unlocked with a key. My grand kids will not know how to open it.
customer_reviews.author: Keno72

customer_reviews.title: Works well!
customer_reviews.text: Bene using this item for years now and works very well. It would sometimes not catch my finger every now and then, but overall I am very satisfied with it.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: A must have for every handgun owner
customer_reviews.text: A must have for every handgun owner. This safe is sturdy and will keep handguns and other small valuables secure and available in a second but only to YOUR finger or anyone else you authorize! I own two of these.
customer_reviews.author: Gregorio

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: Really a great product: compact, tamper resistant, accurate, secure. I'm planning to bolt it to two steel beams in my closet to house my Glock. I thought it would be a 'ho-hum' kind of product, but I am very impressed! A+ product!
customer_reviews.author: Jarvis2grd

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says
customer_reviews.text: We have a large safe but it is not suitable for quick access for home defence so we looked around for a quick access safe. Many available but we chose this product finally after viewing the youtube speed test. Some poor reviews stated difficulty with access with fingerprint but we had used door access in various places and simply you store many pressures & positions to ensure near first time access. My wife gets it right every time me say 1 in 10 needs a retry. Happy with product our sig 229 fits perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: neil abbott

customer_reviews.title: Perfect case for my nightstand
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect case to fit my small .38 special and fits perfectly in my nightstand. I wanted safety with my kids around, so I did not just want something with a number code. Besides-----who can remember the code when you're panicking during a break-in?! This is perfect because it's simple and small.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Pupel

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase with room for improvement
customer_reviews.text: Overall I'm really happy with this purchase. When using the biometric scanner, you hit the button above the scanner first. What's I've noticed is there is a little lag between hitting the button and it's willingness to read your print. It would get 5 stars if you could hit the button, and slide your print in one motion, but instead you have to hit the button, wait 1-2 seconds and then scan your print, otherwise you get a failed reading. A little inefficient if you ask me, I feel like I could plug in a 4 digit code faster.
customer_reviews.author: Reet

product_meta.title: GunVault Microvault Biometric Biometric Pistol Safe MVB500
product_meta.description:
The outside of the Microvault is constructed of heavy-gauge steel with soft foam on the inside to protect the pistol. High-strength lock mechanism performs reliably time after time. Precise fittings are virtually impossible to pry open with hand tools. Built-in computer blocks access after repeated invalid keypad entries. Conveniently located keypad is easy to use. Mounts almost anywhere. Four pre-drilled holes on bottom of vault. For any further queries please contact GunVault Customer care no 800-242-1055. Mon-Sun 6am-8pm PST, excluding major holidays. Troubleshooting Steps: 1.If the unit clicks, but it does not open, 99/100 this issue is related to a battery problem, please replace the battery with a newer Duracell or Energizer regular alkaline and double-check that the expiration date is 5 years ahead of the current year. 2.If the unit does not recognize the code (gives you 3 beeps after entering the sequence) please open the safe using the override key and proceed to reprogram the unit. 3.Almost any issue that may arise from the unit could be traced to a battery issue. But if you are not comfortable with the unit you have we will be more than happy to help you with a replacement unit

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Gunvault pistol safes are truly premium products that set the standard for the rest of the industry. Our patented No-Eyes Keypad and Biometeric pad provide lighting-quick access, even in the dark. Choose the Micro, Mini, Multi or Bio Vault when you need quick access storage for your handgun. We know that security and reliability are prevaling priorities when you need our products, and that's why gunVault pistol safes have the features you want: Improved high strength lock mechanism. Precise fittings virtually impossible to pry open with hand tools. Over 12 million user selectable access codes available. Audio feedback instantly confirms correct keypad entries. Audio disable feature allows "stealth" mode operation. Battery power for maximum security and easy portability. Tamper indicator notes invalid entry attempts. Built in computer blocks access after repeated invalid keypad entries. GunVault Biometric Technology: GunVault Bio uses biometrics, specifically fingerprint recognition, to access the safe contents. A high-performance algorithm is used to achieve speedy identification of enrolled fingerprints; and at the same time has a very low False Reject rate (FRR) for a given False Accept Rate (FAR). This self-learning algorithm of the GunVault Bio adds new minutiae to the fingerprint templates each time a user touches the finger print sensor, which decreases the likelihood of FRR, updates slight changes that might occur over time to an enrolled fingerprint, as well as to help distinguish variations. System can handle a maximum of thirty fingerprint templates between the enrolled fingerprint.
feature_bullets: External dimensions: 11 inches by 8-1/2 inches by 2-1/4 inches
Interior dimensions: 10-3/4 inches about 6-1/2 inches by 2 inches
Accepts up to 30 fingerprints and updates slight changes that might occur over time
Foam lining inside to protect the firearm or other valuables
